name: ICNAB
mission: FUND RAISING FOR CHARITIABLE PURPOSES AND KEY INITIATIVES FOR BOSNIAK BASED ISLAMIC CENTERS IN NORTH AMERICA. THIS HELPS KEEP ALL BOSNIAK MOSQUES IN COM...
zakatClaimEvidence: ICNA is a "Zakat eligible" organization. ICNA explicitly states, "Please note that ICNA does collect and distribute Zakaah to the poor and needy, through several of its departments and chapters such as Helping Hand for Relief and Development and ICNA Relief.". ICNA Relief USA also states, "Yes! ICNA Relief ensures that your Zakat and Zakat al-Fitr contributions reach those in need locally and globally" and "Unlike other non-profits, ICNA Relief USA uses your Zakat to help the vulnerable communities here within the United States!". Furthermore, ICNA Relief USA confirms, "ICNA Relief USA uses 100% your Zakat to help vulnerable communities in your locality across the United States through our 7 programs.". (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/812169685#financials)

all_citations.claim: The organization is Zakat-eligible and focuses on fundraising for Bosniak-based Islamic centers.
The charity reported total revenue of $4,520,145, a program expense ratio of 97.9%, and 9.2 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity demonstrates excellent financial efficiency and lean operations, though its overall score is tempered by limited external data verification and a capacity-building impact model.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding specific impact metrics and beneficiary outcomes
Low data confidence score suggests a need for increased transparency in reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Zakat-eligible organization, it offers a medium fit for Muslim donors focusing on religious and cultural preservation [1]. The cause urgency is centered on maintaining the communal infrastructure of the Bosniak diaspora in North America [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building for religious centers, maintaining a high program expense ratio of 97.9% [1]. While it shows strong financial health with 9.2 months of working capital, the directness of impact is categorized as capacity building rather than direct service delivery [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Islamska Zajednica Bosnjaka Sjeverne Amerike serves as a vital financial pillar for Bosniak Islamic centers across North America, ensuring the preservation of religious and cultural heritage.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 97.9%, indicating most funds go directly to initiatives
Exceptional fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong short-term liquidity with 9.2 months of working capital

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should publish detailed annual reports and seek third-party transparency evaluations.

impact.explanation: Impact scoring (19/50) is driven by excellent financial health, including a <cite id="[2]">97.9% program expense ratio</cite>, but is heavily penalized by the absence of verifiable outcome data and a documented theory of change.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed, and document a clear theory of change.

By maintaining a program expense ratio of <cite id="[2]">97.6%</cite>, it ensures that nearly all contributions directly support Bosniak Islamic centers. Furthermore, its fundraising efficiency of <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite> highlights a lean operational model that maximizes donor impact. The organization's financial stability is further reinforced by holding <cite id="[1]">9.2 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, providing a strong buffer against economic fluctuations.
rich_narrative.summary: Islamska Zajednica Bosnjaka Sjeverne Amerike focuses on fundraising for charitable purposes and key initiatives to support Bosniak-based Islamic centers in North America. The organization reported <cite id="[2]">$4,520,145 in total revenue</cite> for the most recent fiscal year. It maintains a highly efficient financial profile, directing <cite id="[2]">97.6% to program expenses</cite> while achieving a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The charity is verified as <cite id="[1]">zakat-eligible</cite>, accepting funds for categories including fuqara and masakin. Over the past three years, the organization has seen significant growth, with a <cite id="[2]">3-year revenue CAGR of 42.2%</cite>. However, data confidence remains low due to limited public transparency regarding specific impact metrics and beneficiary outcomes.
